skill.name: hypothesis-generation
skill.description: Generate testable hypotheses. Formulate from observations, design experiments, explore competing explanations, develop predictions, propose mechanisms, for scientific inquiry across domains.
skill.summary: Generate testable hypotheses. Formulate from observations, design experiments, explore competing exp...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No credential access, environment harvesting, or network activity detected in the skill files. Content is instructional and LaTeX templates only. No execution or persistence mechanisms found.

content.value_statement: Researchers often struggle to turn observations into rigorous hypotheses. This skill provides a structured workflow and report templates to produce testable hypotheses and experiments.
actual_capabilities: Provide a step by step hypothesis generation workflow
Offer literature search strategies for PubMed and web search
Supply experimental design patterns across study types
Define quality criteria for evaluating hypotheses
Include LaTeX template and style for formatted reports
limitations: Does not perform literature searches or fetch papers
Requires LaTeX tools to compile the report template
Does not provide domain specific data or citations
Relies on user supplied observations and context

use_cases.title: Design thesis hypotheses
use_cases.description: Create competing hypotheses and experiments for a thesis topic.

use_cases.title: Plan study roadmap
use_cases.description: Summarize hypotheses, predictions, and priority tests for a team.

use_cases.title: Explore new mechanism
use_cases.description: Generate mechanistic explanations and experimental designs for a new finding.

prompt_templates.title: Start with observations
prompt_templates.prompt: Given these observations, generate three competing hypotheses and brief mechanistic explanations. Keep each hypothesis distinct and testable.

prompt_templates.title: Add evidence synthesis
prompt_templates.prompt: Summarize current understanding and identify gaps, then propose four hypotheses grounded in the evidence and note key supporting points.

prompt_templates.title: Design experiments
prompt_templates.prompt: For each hypothesis, propose two experiments with controls, measurements, and expected outcomes. Highlight the most discriminating test.

prompt_templates.title: Prepare LaTeX report
prompt_templates.prompt: Fill the LaTeX template with concise main text boxes, then outline appendices for literature, experiments, and quality assessment.

output_examples.input: Generate hypotheses for why urban trees show higher leaf damage in summer.
output: Hypothesis 1: Heat stress weakens leaf defenses, increasing herbivory.
Hypothesis 2: Urban lighting extends insect activity, raising damage rates.
Hypothesis 3: Air pollution disrupts plant signaling, reducing resistance.
Priority test: Compare herbivory under controlled heat and light conditions.

best_practices: Provide clear observations and scope boundaries before generating hypotheses
Keep main text concise and move detail to appendices
Specify falsifiable predictions and discriminating experiments
anti_patterns: Using vague hypotheses without measurable outcomes
Listing many hypotheses without evidence links
Ignoring alternative explanations or conflicting findings

faq.question: What platforms are supported?
faq.answer: Works as a text based skill and LaTeX template. Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code workflows.

faq.question: What are the limits of the output?
faq.answer: Main text is designed for four pages, with detail placed in appendices.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my lab template?
faq.answer: Yes. Use the style file and copy sections into your existing LaTeX document.

faq.question: Does it access or store my data?
faq.answer: No. The skill is static content and does not perform data access.

faq.question: What if my LaTeX build fails?
faq.answer: Use XeLaTeX or LuaLaTeX and ensure required packages are installed.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic writing tools?
faq.answer: It adds hypothesis quality criteria, experiment patterns, and a structured scientific report layout.
